intro: Erussica elongata, commonly known as the longleaf erussica, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, elongated leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typical of the mustard family. It is often found in sandy or well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Erussica elongata is adapted to thrive in regions with moderate to low moisture levels and is relatively drought-tolerant.
